oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-07-23 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from July 23, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers the Louvin Brothers, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Ralph Sloan, Moon Mullican, Minnie Pearl, and Chet Atkins. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Rod Brasfield; Louvin Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Ralph Sloan
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- Kansas City Blues (Ernest Tubb) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Louvin Brothers -- When I Stop Dreaming (Louvin Brothers) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson and Ralph Sloan -- Katy Hill (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Ralph Sloan calls) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- The Old Rugged Cross (Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert jingle (Ernest Tubb)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Jackson, Tommy; Mullican, Moon, 1909-1967; Byrd, Billy; Sloan, Ralph; Louvin Brothers; Louvin, Ira, 1924-1965; Louvin, Charlie, 1927-2011
